member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.HeaderFilterType.include
member.summary: Values in the header filter are unselected initially, and a user can select values to apply a filter.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.HeaderFilterType.exclude
member.summary: All values in the header filter are selected initially. A user can deselect values to change the filter.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.alignment
member.summary: Aligns the content of the column.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowEditing
member.summary: Specifies whether a user can edit values in the column at runtime. By default, inherits the value of the editing.allowUpdating option.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowExporting
member.summary: Specifies whether data from this column should be exported. Applies only if the column is visible.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowFiltering
member.summary: Specifies whether data can be filtered by this column. Applies only if filterRow.visible is true.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowFixing
member.summary: Specifies whether a user can fix the column at runtime. Applies only if columnFixing.enabled is true.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowGrouping
member.summary: Specifies whether the user can group data by values of this column. Applies only when grouping is enabled.
member.remarks: When grouping is enabled in the widget, the user can group data by values of any column. To prohibit a particular column from being used for grouping, set the allowGrouping option of this column to false.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowHeaderFiltering
member.summary: Specifies whether the header filter can be used to filter data by this column. Applies only if headerFilter.visible is true. By default, inherits the value of the allowFiltering option.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowHiding
member.summary: Specifies whether a user can hide the column using the column chooser at runtime. Applies only if columnChooser.enabled is true.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowReordering
member.summary: Specifies whether this column can be used in column reordering at runtime. Applies only if allowColumnReordering is true.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowResizing
member.summary: Specifies whether a user can resize the column at runtime. Applies only if allowColumnResizing is true.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowSearch
member.summary: Specifies whether this column can be searched. Applies only if searchPanel.visible is true. Inherits the value of the allowFiltering option by default.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.allowSorting
member.summary: Specifies whether a user can sort rows by this column at runtime. Applies only if sorting.mode differs from "none".

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.autoExpandGroup
member.summary: Specifies whether groups appear expanded or not when records are grouped by a specific column. Setting this option makes sense only when grouping is allowed for this column.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.buttons
member.summary: Allows you to customize buttons in the editing column or create a custom command column. Applies only if the column's type is "buttons".

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.caption
member.summary: Specifies a caption for the column.
member.remarks: Use this option to display a descriptive or friendly name for the column. If this option is not set, the caption will be generated from the name of the dataField.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.cellTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a custom template for data cells.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.columns
member.summary: An array of grid columns.
member.remarks: Unlike normal columns, band columns do not hold data. Instead, they collect two or more columns under one column header. To set up this layout, declare the band column using a hierarchical structure. For this, assign the nested columns to the columns field of the band column. For example, the following code declares the "Address" band column and nests three columns within it.

member.summary: Specifies a CSS class to be applied to the column.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.dataField
member.summary: Binds the column to a field of the dataSource.

member.summary: Casts column values to a specific data type.
member.remarks: If a data field provides values of one data type, but the widget should cast them to another, specify the proper type in this option.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.editCellTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a custom template for data cells in editing state.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.editorOptions
member.summary: Configures the default widget used for editing and filtering in the filter row.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.encodeHtml
member.summary: Specifies whether HTML tags are displayed as plain text or applied to the values of the column.
member.remarks: When true, HTML tags are displayed as plain text; when false, they are applied to the values of the column.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.falseText
member.summary: In a boolean column, replaces all false items with a specified text. Applies only if showEditorAlways option is false.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.filterOperations
member.summary: Specifies a set of available filter operations. Applies only if filterRow.visible and allowFiltering are true
member.remarks: The following table lists available filters by data types. The same filters are assigned to columns of a specific data type by default. dataType filterOperations "string" [ "contains", "notcontains", "startswith", "endswith", "=", "<>" ] "numeric" [ "=", "<>", "<", ">", "<=", ">=", "between" ] "date" [ "=", "<>", "<", ">", "<=", ">=", "between" ] The filterOperations option can also accept an empty array. In this case, the selected filter operation is "=" for all data types, and a user cannot change it.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.filterType
member.summary: Specifies whether a user changes the current filter by including (selecting) or excluding (clearing the selection of) values. Applies only if headerFilter.visible and allowHeaderFiltering are true.

remarks.para: This option changes when the user clicks the Select All checkbox in the header filter:

Select All filterType / filterValues
filterType: "include"
filterValues: null
filterType: "exclude"
filterValues: null

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.filterValues

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.fixedPosition

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.format
member.summary: Formats a value before it is displayed in a column cell.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.groupCellTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a custom template for group cells (group rows).

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.groupIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index of a column when grid records are grouped by the values of this column.
member.remarks: At runtime, the user can group grid records using the context menu or the group panel. But there may be cases when grid records must be grouped initially. To do this, assign an integer value to the groupIndex option of those columns that should be used for grouping grid records. For example, consider the following data source.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.headerCellTemplate
member.summary: Specifies a custom template for column headers.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.headerFilter
member.summary: Specifies data settings for the header filter.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.hidingPriority
member.summary: Specifies the order in which columns are hidden when the widget adapts to the screen or container size. Ignored if allowColumnResizing is true and columnResizingMode is "widget".
member.remarks: The hidingPriority is a unique positive integer that ascends from right to left beginning with 0 by default. Columns with low hidingPriority are hidden first.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.isBand
member.summary: Specifies whether the column bands other columns or not.
member.remarks: Unlike normal columns, band columns do not hold data. Instead, they collect two or more columns under one column header. In most cases, to set up this layout, you can declare the band column using a hierarchical structure. For example, the following code bands three columns under the "Address" header.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.lookup
member.summary: Specifies options of a lookup column.
member.remarks: A lookup column restricts the set of values that can be chosen when a user edits or filters the column. In a lookup column, each cell is a drop-down menu. You can use a lookup column when you need to substitute displayed values with required values. For example, consider that you have two arrays of objects: drivers and buses.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.minWidth
member.summary: Specifies the minimum width of the column.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.name
member.summary: Specifies the identifier of the column.
member.remarks: Set this option if you need to refer to the column in your code afterwards, for example, when changing a column option.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.ownerBand
member.summary: Specifies the band column that owns the current column. Accepts the index of the band column in the columns array.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.renderAsync
member.summary: Specifies whether to render the column after other columns and elements. Use if column cells have a complex template. Requires the width option specified.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.selectedFilterOperation
member.summary: Specifies the column's filter operation displayed in the filter row.
member.remarks: Accepted Values: '<' | '<=' | '<>' | '=' | '>' | '>=' | 'between' | 'contains' | 'endswith' | 'notcontains' | 'startswith'

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.showEditorAlways
member.summary: Specifies whether the column displays its values using editors.
member.remarks: A column cell has normal and editing states. In a normal state, the cell value is text. In the editing state, the cell contains an editor that indicates the cell value and allows a user to edit it. In certain cases, a viewer reads the cell value easier if it is indicated by an editor even in the normal state. For example, boolean values are more comprehensible when they are indicated by check boxes. To display editors in cells permanently, set the showEditorAlways option to true.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.showInColumnChooser
member.summary: Specifies whether the column chooser can contain the column header.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.showWhenGrouped
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to display the column when grid records are grouped by it.
member.remarks: Displaying a grouping column may be useful if you calculate its grouping values. Consider that you need to group records by a column that contains dates. Grouping by full dates seems inconvenient. It would be smarter to group by months or years instead. For this purpose, you calculate grouping values within the calculateGroupValue function and leave the grouping column visible by setting the showWhenGrouped option to true so that the user can view the full dates.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.sortIndex
member.summary: Specifies the index according to which columns participate in sorting.
member.remarks: This option accepts an integer specifying the index of the column in a collection of columns with applied sorting. For example, consider the following data source that can provide data for three columns.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.sortOrder
member.summary: Specifies the sort order of column values.
member.remarks: Accepted Values: undefined | 'asc' | 'desc'

By default, rows are sorted according to the data source. Set the sortOrder option to sort rows in a required order. If you need to sort by multiple columns, specify the sortIndex option as well, or otherwise, each sorted column will get a sort index according to the position in the columns array.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.trueText
member.summary: In a boolean column, replaces all true items with a specified text. Applies only if showEditorAlways option is false.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.type
member.summary: Specifies the command column that this object customizes.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.validationRules
member.summary: Specifies validation rules to be checked when cell values are updated.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.visible
member.summary: Specifies whether the column is visible, that is, occupies space in the table.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridColumn.visibleIndex

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.cellHintEnabled
member.summary: Enables a hint that appears when a user hovers the mouse pointer over a cell with truncated content.
member.remarks: The cell's content may be truncated if the width of the cell's column becomes very small. In this case, when a user hovers the mouse pointer over such a cell, a hint containing the cell's value appears. To disable cell hints, assign false to the cellHintEnabled option.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.columnAutoWidth
member.summary: Specifies whether columns should adjust their widths to the content.
member.remarks: When this option is set to true, all columns adjust their width to the content. If the widget's overall content is narrower than the widget's width, the columns are stretched to fit the widget. To avoid this, set the columns.width option to "auto". If the content is wider, the columnAutoWidth option set to true causes horizontal scrolling. You can set the allowHiding option to false for columns you want to be displayed continuously. When the columnAutoWidth option is set to false, all columns have identical width, which in turn depends on the width of the widget.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.columnChooser
member.summary: Configures the column chooser.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.columnHidingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the widget should hide columns to adapt to the screen or container size. Ignored if allowColumnResizing is true and columnResizingMode is "widget".
member.remarks: This option set to true makes the widget hide certain columns automatically if all the columns do not fit the widget's width. Columns with low hidingPriority are hidden first. These are the rightmost (leftmost if rtlEnabled is true) columns by default. Information from hidden columns is available in an adaptive detail row.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.columnMinWidth
member.summary: Specifies the minimum width of columns.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.ColumnResizingMode.nextColumn
member.summary: When a user resizes a column, the width of the next column changes.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.ColumnResizingMode.widget
member.summary: When a user resizes a column, the width of the widget changes. This mode is ignored if you specify the width of any column in percent.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.columnResizingMode
member.summary: Specifies how the widget resizes columns. Applies only if allowColumnResizing is true.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.columns
member.summary: An array of grid columns.
member.remarks: By default, a column is created for each field of a data source object, but in most cases, it is redundant. To specify a set of columns to be created in a grid, assign an array specifying these columns to the columns option. Each grid column is represented in this array by an object containing column settings or by a data source field that this column is bound to. Detailed information on specifying grid columns is given in the Columns Overview article. Column options define the behavior and appearance of a grid column. One of the other capabilities allows you to control the sorting of column values using the allowSorting and sortOrder options, apply a filter to grid records using the allowFiltering and filterOperations options, and group grid records using the allowGrouping and groupIndex options. In addition, you can change the visibility and width of a column using corresponding options. To get or set an option or several options for a column at runtime, use the columnOption method with the required arguments.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.columnWidth
member.summary: Specifies the width for all data columns. Has a lower priority than the column.width option.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.dataSource
member.summary: Binds the widget to data

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.dateSerializationFormat
member.summary: Specifies the format in which date-time values should be sent to the server. Use it only if you do not specify the dataSource at design time.
member.remarks: Without a data source, the widget cannot detect the date-time values' format. In this case, specify the dateSerializationFormat option that supports the following formats: "yyyy-MM-dd" - a local date "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss" - local date and time "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssZ" - the UTC date and time "yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ssx" - date and time with a timezone This option applies only if the forceIsoDateParsing field is set to true in the global configuration object.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.disabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the widget responds to user interaction.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.editing
member.summary: Configures editing.
member.remarks: The widget can allow a user to add, update and delete data. To control which of these operations are allowed, use the allowAdding, allowUpdating and allowDeleting options. Editing can be carried out in different modes, which are detailed in the mode option's description.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.errorRowEnabled
member.summary: Indicates whether to show the error row.
member.remarks: The error row displays data-related errors that may occur on the server during the widget's runtime. Setting this option to false hides the error row, but the errors can still be viewed in the browser's console.

member.summary: Specifies whether to synchronize the filter row, header filter, and filter builder. The synchronized filter expression is stored in the filterValue option.

member.summary: Specifies a filter expression.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.focusedColumnIndex
member.summary: The index of the column that contains the focused data cell.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.focusedRowEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the focused row feature is enabled.
member.remarks: When this option is set to true, the following applies: Rows are initially sorted by keys if any field of remoteOperations is true. The row with focusedRowIndex or focusedRowKey is highlighted. When the data row area is focused, this row is focused and the area is scrolled down to it. The onFocusedRowChanging and onFocusedRowChanged functions become active.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.focusedRowIndex
member.summary: Specifies the initially or currently focused grid row's index. Use it when focusedRowEnabled is true.
member.remarks: The focused row has a key and index on a page. When the pager is used for navigation, the focused row's index persists from page to page but corresponds to a different row with a different key on each page. The default index, -1, means that no row is focused. The focusedRowKey takes precedence over the focusedRowIndex when both are specified.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.focusedRowKey
member.summary: Specifies initially or currently focused grid row's key. Use it when focusedRowEnabled is true.
member.remarks: The focused row has a key and index on a page. When the pager is used for navigation, the focused row's index persists from page to page but corresponds to a different row with a different key on each page. In the DxDataGrid, group rows can also be focused. See the Group Index and Key topic for more information on how group keys are formed.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.focusStateEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the widget can be focused using keyboard navigation.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.masterDetail
member.summary: Allows you to build a master-detail interface in the grid.
member.remarks: In DxDataGrid, a master-detail interface supplies a usual data row with an expandable section that contains the details on this data row. In that case, the data row is called "master row", while the section is called "detail section". To enable the master-detail interface, assign true to the masterDetail.enabled option. After that, specify the template for detail sections using the masterDetail.template option. Templates allow you to place virtually anything into the detail sections. For example, you can display another DxDataGrid or any other UI widget there. For more information on specifying the template for the detail sections, see the template option description.

member.summary: Configures paging.
member.remarks: Paging allows the widget to load data in portions instead of loading it simultaneously. To enable paging, set the paging.enabled option to true. Users can switch between pages and change paging settings using the pager or they can scroll the pages. Paging settings apply with any scrolling mode.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.selection
member.summary: Configures runtime selection.
member.remarks: A user can select rows in a single or multiple mode. In multiple mode, a user can select all rows at once. To disable this feature, assign false to the allowSelectAll. By default, once a user selects a row, the data source is instantly notified about it. This may lower the widget performance if the data source is remote and the user is allowed to select all rows at once. In this case, we recommend making the selection deferred.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridOptions.selectionFilter
member.summary: Specifies filters for the rows that must be selected initially. Applies only if selection.deferred is true.
member.remarks: This option also allows you to obtain filter expressions for the currently selected rows. Note that if all records are selected, the selectionFilter value is null. If there are no selected records, the value contains an empty array.

member.name: T:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling
member.summary: Scrolling allows a user to browse data left outside the current viewport. The widget provides several scrolling modes detailed in the mode option description.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.ColumnRenderingMode.standard
member.summary: Renders all columns at once.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.ColumnRenderingMode.virtual
member.summary: Renders only those columns that get into the viewport.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.RowRenderingMode.standard
member.summary: Renders all the loaded rows at once.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.RowRenderingMode.virtual
member.summary: Renders only those rows that get into the viewport. Use this mode if the pageSize is large. Rows that are being currently rendered can be shown as grey boxes.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.ScrollingMode.standard
member.summary: A user scrolls a single page only. Scrolling is available only if all the page's rows do not fit into the widget's height. In this mode, the pager performs the main navigation and scrolling is auxiliary. If paging is disabled, the widget loads all rows simultaneously which can reduce the widget's performance. In this case, we recommend that you use another scrolling mode.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.ScrollingMode.infinite
member.summary: Each next page is loaded once the scrollbar reaches the end of its scale. In this mode, users scroll data gradually from the first to the last page.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.ScrollingMode.virtual
member.summary: Rows are loaded when they get into the viewport and removed once they leave it. If the rows take time to be loaded and rendered, they display gray boxes. Rendering optimization can reduce rendering time and remove gray boxes. In this mode, users can move to any page instantly.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.columnRenderingMode
member.summary: Specifies the rendering mode for columns. Applies when columns are left outside the viewport. Requires the columnWidth, columnAutoWidth, or width (for all columns) option specified.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.mode
member.summary: Specifies the scrolling mode.
member.remarks: Regardless of the scrolling mode, you can use the paging.pageSize option to specify the number of rows on a page.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.preloadEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the widget should load adjacent pages. Applies only if scrolling.mode is "virtual" or "infinite".
member.remarks: In virtual and infinite scrolling modes, pages are loaded on demand. If you set this option to true, the adjacent pages are loaded in advance for smoother scrolling. This option can reduce the performance on older devices.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.rowRenderingMode
member.summary: Specifies the rendering mode for loaded rows.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.scrollByContent
member.summary: Specifies whether a user can scroll the content with a swipe gesture. Applies only if useNative is false.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.scrollByThumb
member.summary: Specifies whether a user can scroll the content with the scrollbar. Applies only if useNative is false.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.showScrollbar
member.summary: Specifies when to show scrollbars. Applies only if useNative is false.
member.remarks: The scrollbars help to scroll the content vertically and horizontally. Vertical scrolling is available when all the rows do not fit in the widget's height. Horizontal scrolling is available when all the columns do not fit in the widget's width, which can happen when columns have fixed widths or the columnAutoWidth option is set to true.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridScrolling.useNative
member.summary: Specifies whether the widget should use native or simulated scrolling.
member.remarks: By default, the widget employs native scrolling on most platforms, except non-Mac desktops and devices based on Android older than version 4. To employ native scrolling on all platforms without exception, assign true to this option. If you assign false, the widget simulates scrolling on all platforms.By default, the widget employs native scrolling on most platforms, except non-Mac desktops and devices based on Android older than version 4. To employ native scrolling on all platforms without exception, assign true to this option. If you assign false, the widget simulates scrolling on all platforms.

member.name: T:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection
member.summary: Configures runtime selection.
member.remarks: A user can select rows in a single or multiple mode. In multiple mode, a user can select all rows at once. To disable this feature, assign false to the allowSelectAll. By default, once a user selects a row, the data source is instantly notified about it. This may lower the widget performance if the data source is remote and the user is allowed to select all rows at once. In this case, we recommend making the selection deferred.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.SelectionMode.none
member.summary: The none

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.SelectionMode.single
member.summary: Only one row can be in the selected state at a time.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.SelectionMode.multiple
member.summary: Several rows can be in the selected state at a time.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.SelectAllMode.allPages
member.summary: Selects records on all pages.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.SelectAllMode.page
member.summary: Selects records on currently rendered page.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.ShowCheckBoxesMode.onClick
member.summary: Check boxes appear once a user clicks anywhere in the selection column, or if two or more rows are selected programmatically or using keyboard shortcuts. Check boxes disappear once rows selection is canceled.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.ShowCheckBoxesMode.none
member.summary: Check boxes are always hidden, which means that selection is always single-like in this mode.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.ShowCheckBoxesMode.always
member.summary: The selection column with all the check boxes is always visible. A user can select a row by clicking the check box or its grid cell, but not the row itself.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.ShowCheckBoxesMode.onLongTap
member.summary: The selection column with all the check boxes appears and disappears on long tap, and on click and hold.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.allowSelectAll
member.summary: Specifies whether a user can select all rows at once.
member.remarks: If this option is set to true, it allows a user to select all rows at once by pressing Ctrl + A or clicking the check box in the selection column's header. The "Select All" check box also allows a user to deselect all rows. The select all functionality allows selecting/deselecting only those rows that meet filtering conditions if a filter is applied. If this option is set to false, it disables the select all functionality. In this case, the check box clears selection and is hidden if no rows are selected.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.mode
member.summary: Specifies the selection mode.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.deferred
member.summary: Makes selection deferred.
member.remarks: Consider making selection deferred if the widget needs to operate a large volume of data and the user is allowed to select all rows at once. Unlike usual (or "instant") selection, in the case of deferred selection, the widget requests data only when you demand this using the API, for example, when the getSelectedRowsData() or getSelectedRowKeys() method is called. This mode has certain specifics that determine the API you need to use. For more information, see the Deferred Selection article.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.selectAllMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode in which all the records are selected. Applies only if selection.allowSelectAll is true.
member.remarks: selectAllMode specifies how records should be selected on clicking the "Select All" check box and by calling the selectAll()/deselectAll() methods. The following modes are available.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSelection.showCheckBoxesMode
member.summary: Specifies when to display check boxes in rows. Applies only if selection.mode is "multiple".
member.remarks: The selection behavior in multiple mode depends on the check boxes' visibility. Selection is proper multiple only when check boxes are visible. In other cases, the selection behavior resembles the single mode: clicking (or tapping) a row selects it, but cancels the selection of other rows. However, a user still can select multiple rows in this mode using a click and hold, or long tap.

member.name: T:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSorting
member.summary: Configures the filter row.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSorting.GridSortingMode.single
member.summary: Rows can be sorted by values of a single column only.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSorting.GridSortingMode.multiple
member.summary: Rows can be sorted by values of several columns.

member.name: F:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSorting.GridSortingMode.none
member.summary: No sorting.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSorting.mode
member.summary: Specifies the sorting mode.

member.name: T:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummary
member.summary: Configures the filter row.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummary.groupItems
member.summary: Specifies items of the group summary.
member.remarks:
The group summary provides a synopsis of a group of data. Groups of data are formed in the process of grouping. The group summary contains several items. Each item displays a value that is a product of applying an aggregate function to a group of data.
To specify the items of the group summary, declare an array of objects, each of which contains at least two fields: column and summaryType. The column field specifies the identifier of the column that provides data for an aggregate function. The summaryType specifies the aggregate function to be applied.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummary.recalculateWhileEditing
member.summary: Specifies whether to recalculate summaries while a user edits data.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummary.skipEmptyValues
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to skip empty strings, null and undefined values when calculating a summary.
member.remarks: Specified in the summary object, this option affects all summaries in the grid. In addition, the same option can be specified for an individual summary. It will override the global setting.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummaryGroupItem.alignByColumn
member.summary: Indicates whether to display group summary items in parentheses after the group row header or to align them by the corresponding columns within the group row.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummaryGroupItem.column
member.summary: Specifies the column that provides data for a group summary item.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummaryGroupItem.displayFormat
member.summary: Specifies the summary item's text.
member.remarks:
You can use the following position markers in this text:
{0} - formatted summary value. {1} - the parent column's caption. Available if the showInColumn option is specified.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummaryGroupItem.name
member.summary: Specifies the group summary item's identifier.
member.remarks: Use this name to access the summary item in callback functions like calculateCustomSummary.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummaryGroupItem.showInColumn
member.summary: Specifies the column that must hold the summary item when this item is displayed in the group footer or aligned by a column in the group row.
member.remarks: A group summary item can be forced to be displayed in the group row by the column that provides data for this item. Alternatively, you can place an item to the group footer where the item is also held by the column that provides data for it. If you need to place an item in another column, assign the name, data field or caption of this column to the showInColumn option.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummaryGroupItem.showInGroupFooter
member.summary: pecifies whether or not a summary item must be displayed in the group footer.
member.remarks: By default, summary items are displayed as a part of a group row. If you need a summary item to be displayed in the group footer, assign true to the showInGroupFooter option of this item. This summary item will be located in the column that provides data for it. If you want another column to hold the summary item, specify the showInColumn option of this item.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummaryGroupItem.skipEmptyValues
member.summary: Specifies whether or not to skip empty strings, null and undefined values when calculating a summary.
member.remarks: Specified in a summary configuration object, this option affects an individual summary item. If you need to apply a single setting to all summaries in a grid, specify the skipEmptyValues option in the summary object.

member.name: P:Emby.Web.GenericEdit.Elements.DxGrid.DxGridSummaryGroupItem.summaryType
member.summary: Specifies how to aggregate data for the group summary item.
member.remarks: Use the SummaryType enum to specify this option when the widget is used as an ASP.NET MVC 5 Control or a DevExtreme-Based ASP.NET Core Control. This enum accepts the following values: Sum, Min, Max, Avg, Count, and Custom. To apply a custom server-side aggregate function, use a string overload instead.
